question: [File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: QuorumStoreConfig::default()] [Zero worker deadlock] If num_workers_for_remote_batches is 0, does this mean no workers are created to process remote batches, causing all remote batch messages to queue indefinitely and eventually exhaust memory? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: QuorumStoreConfig::default()] [Bucket overflow] The batch_buckets uses DEFAULT_BUCKETS which could contain u64::MAX values - can extremely large bucket values cause overflow in bucket-based batch categorization logic? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: QuorumStoreConfig::default()] [Empty buckets] Can setting batch_buckets to an empty Vec cause division by zero or array index out of bounds errors when trying to categorize batches into buckets? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: QuorumStoreConfig::default()] [Bucket manipulation] Can a Byzantine validator configure batch_buckets differently from honest validators, causing batches to be categorized inconsistently across the network and leading to consensus disagreement? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: QuorumStoreConfig::default()] [POS bypass vulnerability] Can setting allow_batches_without_pos_in_proposal to true allow validators to include batches without proper proof-of-store, potentially including duplicate or invalid transactions that bypass validation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: QuorumStoreConfig::default()] [Feature flag inconsistency] If some validators have enable_opt_quorum_store=true while others have it false, can this cause network partition where two groups process batches differently and reach different state roots? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: QuorumStoreConfig::default()] [Batch age manipulation] Can setting opt_qs_minimum_batch_age_usecs to 0 allow freshly created batches to be used immediately without proper propagation, potentially allowing double-inclusion or censorship attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: QuorumStoreConfig::default()] [Age overflow] Can opt_qs_minimum_batch_age_usecs set to u64::MAX cause timestamp comparison overflow, making batches appear infinitely old or infinitely young depending on comparison logic? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: QuorumStoreConfig::default()] [Payload version mismatch] If enable_payload_v2 is set differently across validators, can this cause incompatible payload formats where some validators cannot deserialize batches from others, causing consensus failure? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: QuorumStoreConfig::default()] [Batch version attack] Can enable_batch_v2 being false on Byzantine validators allow them to send v1 batches that bypass v2 security improvements, potentially reintroducing previously patched vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: default_for_dag()] [DAG batch size attack] The DAG config uses sender_max_batch_txns of 300 vs default 50 - can this 6x increase be exploited to overwhelm non-DAG validators if configs are mixed in a network? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: default_for_dag()] [DAG byte limit bypass] The DAG sender_max_batch_bytes of 4MB vs default 1MB - can this be used to create oversized batches that fit DAG limits but crash regular nodes if accidentally sent to them? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: default_for_dag()] [DAG backlog manipulation] The DAG backlog_txn_limit_count is 100,000 vs default 36,000 - can Byzantine validators exploit this to force DAG nodes to accumulate far more pending transactions and exhaust memory? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: default_for_dag()] [DAG throughput mismatch] DAG dynamic_max_txn_per_s is only 200 vs default 12,000 - can this massive reduction be exploited to intentionally starve DAG consensus of transactions while claiming to be properly configured? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: sanitize_send_recv_batch_limits()] [Race condition] The sanitization checks run at config load time, but can config values be modified at runtime after sanitization, bypassing these critical send <= recv checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: sanitize_send_recv_batch_limits()] [Comparison overflow] The comparisons 'send > recv' use usize - can integer overflow in extremely large configs cause the comparison to incorrectly pass when send is actually larger after wrapping? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: sanitize_send_recv_batch_limits()] [Error handling bypass] If Error::ConfigSanitizerFailed is ignored or caught without proper handling in calling code, can invalid configs still be used despite failing sanitization? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: sanitize_send_recv_batch_limits()] [Txn count check] Does the function properly validate that sender_max_batch_txns <= receiver_max_batch_txns, or can equal values at the maximum usize cause edge cases in batch processing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: sanitize_send_recv_batch_limits()] [Byte count check] The bytes validation checks sender_max_batch_bytes vs receiver_max_batch_bytes, but does it account for the BATCH_PADDING_BYTES asymmetry where sender subtracts but receiver adds? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: sanitize_send_recv_batch_limits()] [Total txn bypass] While checking total_txns limits, can a validator configure sender_max_total_txns just below receiver_max_total_txns but use sender_max_num_batches to create more batches than expected? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: sanitize_send_recv_batch_limits()] [Total bytes arithmetic] The total_bytes comparison doesn't validate the complex default calculation with padding - can the calculation itself overflow and bypass this check? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: sanitize_batch_total_limits()] [Batch exceeds total] The function checks batch <= total, but can batch == total cause issues where a single batch uses the entire quota leaving no room for multiple batches? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: sanitize_batch_total_limits()] [Send txn validation gap] Checking sender_max_batch_txns <= sender_max_total_txns doesn't account for sender_max_num_batches - can max_num_batches * max_batch_txns exceed max_total_txns? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: sanitize_batch_total_limits()] [Send bytes overflow] If sender_max_batch_bytes * sender_max_num_batches overflows usize before comparison to sender_max_total_bytes, can this bypass the validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/quorum_store_config.rs] [Function: sanitize_batch_total_limits()] [Recv validation bypass] The recv_txns and recv_bytes checks don't validate against receiver_max_num_batches - can num_batches * batch_size legitimately exceed total limits? (Medium)
